Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the private IP setup, including the number of IPs needed, subnet configurations, and integration with existing on-premises or Azure networks.
Plan the IP addressing scheme, including subnet ranges, CIDR blocks, and address allocation for Azure resources.
Set up a virtual network (VNet) in Azure to host the private IPs. Define subnets and ensure proper segmentation for security and performance.
Create and configure subnets within the virtual network. Assign private IP ranges to each subnet based on the addressing scheme.
Assign private IP addresses to Azure resources such as virtual machines, load balancers, or application gateways within the VNet.
Set up NSGs to control inbound and outbound traffic to and from the subnets and resources using private IPs.
Configure Azure Private Link to securely access Azure services over private IPs, ensuring no traffic traverses the public internet.
Verify connectivity between resources using private IPs. Test scenarios include intra-subnet communication, inter-subnet communication, and access to on-premises networks (if applicable).
Set up monitoring for the private IP setup using Azure Monitor and Network Watcher. Configure alerts for unusual traffic patterns or connectivity issues.
Document the private IP setup, including the IP addressing scheme, subnet configurations, and security measures. Share the documentation with relevant stakeholders.
Provide training to the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the private IP setup, including monitoring tools and security configurations.
Conduct periodic audits to ensure the private IP setup complies with organizational policies and security standards.
